title: Why riot is so cautious about nerfing Zed?
body:
But they don't trully care about butchering some champions?
Makes no sense to me. That 35 decrease base damage on Zed will not do anything with the 75% multi-target shuriken buff.

> [{quoted}](name=B1naryB0t,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=AAF8X6yl,comment-id=00030000000000000000,timestamp=2016-05-28T02:10:18.114+0000)
>
> At least talon has a terrible laning phase to handle, unlike Zed, who for some reason is a lane bully.

The current nerf is supposed to hit that, but I think they're completely missing the problem. Sure hitting a single Q does less damage now, but Zed's entire laning phase is about hitting those single Q's. He's not trying to nuke you, he's trying to slowly whittle you down with his endless resource pool until you have to back and he doesn't, so he can just free farm while you're gone, or roam while you have no health so he knows you can't follow. This change doesn't change that, it just delays it by maybe 30 seconds at best.

As long as he can poke you nonstop and never have to worry about mana, he's gonna keep winning lane.

Wait a second, you just contradicted yourself.

>Zed's entire laning phase is about hitting those single Q's. He's not trying to nuke you, he's trying to slowly whittle you down with his endless resource pool.

Syndra as well used to be a huge lane bully - largely because her Q had high damage on lvl 1, low mana cost and insanely low CD. She wasn't trying to nuke you either but 3 or 4 consecutive Qs + Ignite was your death penalty. That was even before the Thunderlord's.
As soon as her damage got nerfed, she is no longer bullying people out of lanes.

Why do you think the same treatment for Zed won't work?
His poke nerf (-10% AD ratio and -5/-25 AD) does not lessen his poke potential?
First of all, this impacts his ranged wave clear (if he doesn't want to take free damage from you) and then it impacts his poke damage. It stands to reason that you certainly won't eat every single of his shurikens which then means even more staying power for you in lane - aka he can no longer bully you out that easily.

Not to mention that the cheapening of Zhonya's is also Zed's indirect nerf and you also have to that into account before making an argument about Zed needing to be nerfed harder.

You forgot this part:

"his endless resource pool"

Shall we compare Zed's mana costs with Syndra's?

He was literally designed to counter midlane

I'm fairly sure at the time of Zed's design most people were not willing to run assassin mids (Season 2 was great BTW). The only assassin who really saw play mid was Kassadin in the 3% of games he wasn't banned. Most other assassins only really saw play top, Akali, Kat, Fizz and to somewhat of an extent Talon were all viewed as top laners with an off role in mid. The general consensus on Zed's release was that he'd be a top laner. So I don't think he was really designed to counter midlane.

At the time of Zed's design, mid lane had 5 "viable" champions, all of them assassins. 

That would be:
Fizz, Khazix (then with the spikes first build), Ahri, Kassadin and rarely Leblanc.

he and yasuo both counter about 90% of the mid lane roster. you can look it up when you look up counters for either yasuo or zed you will find that top laners counter them because they are too tanky to handle them

anyone remember the "lee sin" issue back in seasons 3 and 4? where they refused to nerf him cuz of the LC$BigPlay$?

That happened in Season 5 if I recall too. "We want to encourage all Lee Sin players, so we're adding 20% bonus health of whatever you kick **IN ADDITION TO THAT OUTRAGEOUS 200% AD RATIO ON A COMPLETELY UNAVOIDABLE SKILL.** "
Really though.  What was the point in that?  As Lee Sin, isn't your main target the squishy ADC who builds pretty much no defense?  Genuine question.

[From the official 5.16 patch notes:](http://na.leagueoflegends.com/en/news/game-updates/patch/patch-516-notes)

"For professionals, Lee Sin is a perfect champion; a strong contributor at each stage of the game, flexible in item builds and adaptable to almost any scenario. For the average player however, he’s that champion you wish you didn’t see on your team due to the sheer number of games required to reach a certain level of competency.

Because of this, these changes are aimed at raising Lee’s floor (that is to say his ‘basic effectiveness’) rather than his maximum potential and give an edge to those players taking their first steps on the road of Blind-Monasticism." 

There was also a buff to his passive where it recovered 20 energy on first hit and 10 on second, up from 15 on both. This was a generally well-received improvement.

Basically, they wanted to buff Lee Sins who were incapable of InSecing by making it so you can Ult the Frontline and still have done something. http://media.tumblr.com/1fff100ae87cbe7eea877de443f03ec6/tumblr_inline_muo24ceYPF1qjifel.gif

Zed is an assassin, if he has not enough damage to kill his target, he is worthless. That's why you can't nerf his damage.
So how do you want to nerf him instead? Reduce his non existent utility?
Zed has nothing but damage and you can't nerf his damage because he must be able to kill people in one rotation.
The only way to nerf zed without making him useless, is to make his damage harder to access.
plus according to riot, Zed is their baseline for ALL assassins that use either hybrid ad or full ad

They consider Ekko and Yasuo well designed.

Their opinion is shit when it comes to assassins, tbfh.

Yasuo is probably one of the better designed assassins. He doesn't have insane wave clear. He has clear moments of power and weakness. He is evenly matched in the early game, but will turn into a madman mid/late if you get him fed. His only reliable way to ult is by throwing out an easily dodgeable skillshot or through team synergy. While his crit passive may be annoying his actual kit is very well designed.

Pretty much this. He's balanced around his crit passive too though so that's not really a negative point. He has his Q and autos to do the bulk of his damage where other assassins have 3 or more damaging abilities. 
That said, he's not really meant to be an assassin per se. He's more a high damage fighter like Fiora, Tryndamere or Master Yi. His kit reflects that in that it has more utility than assassins, who usually have mostly or all damaging abilities as stated. [Riot themselves go into this further in one of their devblogs](http://na.leagueoflegends.com/en/news/game-updates/gameplay/dev-blog-classes-subclasses), calling Yasuo and Fiora "skirmishers", a subclass under Slayers alongside assassins.
anyone who has mastered and mains Yasuo will never really lose to anyone 1v1
Good thing this game isn't a 1v1.

Yasuo can win 2v1 as well tbh. I have done it once or twice.
But yeah i am not that good on Yasuo.
